content: write a line erase a line written by corin purifoy write a line erase a line was inspired by the song joan in the garden an epic journey through the visions of joan of arc as told by the band the decemberists specifically the shawl is my interpretation of the first two movements of the song a quiet day in the garden becomes a hypnotic psychedelic trance and a purpose is revealed write/erase is crocheted from the center out to the edges increasing along the outer edges and in the center using texture lace and the delicate addition of seed beads the pattern is easy enough to memorize but full of visual interest the result is a light and airy shawl that is the perfect addition to spring and autumn outfits pattern information yarn and notions stitches and abbreviations con t approximately 940-960 yds 860-878m single_crochet -
